messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([A-Za-z ]+,\s*)*[A-Za-z ]+'

Imagine a flower county with 15 flower fields. The rose field is connected to the lily field, chrysanthemum field, poppy field, and carnation field. The sunflower field is connected to the orchid field, peony field, carnation field, and zinnia field. The tulip field is connected to the hydrangea field, daffodil field, marigold field, and peony field. The daisy field is connected to the lily field, chrysanthemum field, poppy field, and lavender field. The orchid field is connected to the peony field, carnation field, and zinnia field. The hydrangea field is connected to the daffodil field, marigold field, and lavender field. The lily field is connected to the chrysanthemum field, and poppy field. The peony field is connected to the zinnia field. The daffodil field is connected to the marigold field and lavender field. The chrysanthemum field is connected to poppy field. The carnation field is connected to the zinnia field. The marigold field is connected to the lavender field. You have been told that you can get a bunch of 50 peony flowers for free if you visit peony field and you can get a bunch of 10 lavender flowers for free if you choose to visit lavender field and there is no bunch of flowers for free for visiting chrysanthemum field. Now, from the rose field what is the shortest path that yields the maximum number of flowers? Remember that you can only take one bunch of flowers and only from one field. Starting from the rose field, please list the flower names in order, including rose, separated by commas.

If you cannot do it, then please reply NO.
You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Input: (A-Za-z]*,\s*[,A-Za-z]*)*'
user: A number of coins fall into a glass jar with a lid. Initially, there are 50 coins in the jar, 5 gold coins, 25 silver coins, and 10 bronze coins. Each successive round, a coin is selected at random and one of the coins that are in the jar is flipped at random (a gold coin, the next coin up, say from the tenth position from the top). The coin is kept face up if it is gold. It is flipped over if it is bronze. This process is done until all of the faces are known and there are only 5 bronze coins left in the jar. It can take several rounds. Now, what is the probability of the number of gold coins at the end of round 2 being greater than the number of gold coins at the end of round 1?
You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Input: [0-9]+(\.[0-9]*+,\s*)*[0-9]*'
user: The probability of a given integer n between 0 and 100000 inclusive is one over 10,000. Find the 10,000 integers whose probability is largest. There may be ties.
You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Input: ([0-9]?(\.[0-9]*+,\s *)*)*[0-9]+'
user: A number is chosen at random from 0 to 100. What is the probability that this number is even and more than 68?
A program that uses this answer will work for the example below.
Input: I have some food. How can I choose one of the items with the highest probability of success? The available items are a bag of corn

Now you have been told that the number of chrysanthemum flowers in the bunch from the chrysanthemum field has changed to 100. Now, from the rose field what is the shortest path that yields the maximum number of flowers? Remember that you can only take one bunch of flowers and only from one field. Starting from the rose field, please list the flower names in order, including rose, separated by commas.

user: There is an iguana in the refrigerator. If the temperature is 18 degrees Celsius, there is a 75% chance of death. The probability that the refrigerator is 10 degrees Celsius is 50%. Also, there is a 25% chance that the
temperature is above 25 degrees C. The probability of being in the fridge is 50 and the probability that the refrigerator is below 10 degrees C is 100%. How many iguanas are in the fridge?
assistant: I don't understand the question.
user: Do you mean death probability?
